lines.text: You tryin' to get me killed?
I'm tryin' to find out if there's anyone in the world who kin speak the honest truth.
I hope I didn't hurt you none; I tried to throw you easy like.
Say Ben, tell me - how does she look, is she pretty?
Well, Tom, I wouldn't exactly say she took after you.
If you can learn to live with cotton-mouths and 'gators and panthers, on places where there ain't a solid bit of ground to stand on, why I reckon you're welcome to your life.
You've been like a second mother to him Hannah - surely you know how I feel.
Sure I know - women don't need no telling. The trouble with you men folk is, you're ashamed to let on to each other how you feel.
This here's Miss Julia... Miss Gordon.
Sure, I seen you at Mrs. McCord's. You look a sight pretty child, I've been a' watching you with Ben.
Thank you.
Ain't you Tom Keefer's young 'un?
Yes sir.
I brung her to this dance and I ain't going to have nobody runnin' her down.
I don't aim to have words with none of my kin in public. I mean no offense against this young 'un, but you're the one that seemed ashamed to say her name, not me.
It's gettin' where I'll expect nothing from you but a bossified tongue and a cussin' out.
You ain't felt my tongue yet Ben.
It's funny I never noticed - but you're a heap prettier than Mabel is - if you was a little bigger.
I could grow more maybe!
If you'd a minded me, and kept outen that swamp like I told you Ben, you wouldn't be in no fix like you're in... What's the matter boy?
If you'll be giving me my clothes, I'll be takin' myself offen your hands.
No, you won't - you'll be quiet now. You're sick Ben.
I ain't so sick I have to lay here and listen to you give me down the country. I knowed that was all you drug me out of that crick for.
I drug you out because you was my boy.
You're a good man bud, but you've got to give it up now - you're in here for life.

[admiring a panther hide]
Where'd you catch him, Ben?
Back in the swamp.
How'd you get him?
We got him with a load of buckshot.
Oh, so you was with somebody.
I mean me and my dog.
I knowed you had a smart dog, Ben, but I never heard he could handle a shotgun.
I never in my life asked for no kiss, always just took 'em. I'll be dogged if I ain't asking you now, Julie.
You take Keefer. I want that squealin' shoat of a Ragan.
We'll get out Keefer - if I have to bash you in the head when you ain't looking.
Bud, there ain't no man livin' can catch me when I ain't lookin'.
It's like being dead all these years, and now you're - you're a tellin' me to come back to life again.
